msIdentifier.repository: Library of the Institute of Chinese Studies

physDesc.p: The characters are written in about 30 columns with almost no space above and to the side, it very much resembles classical texts.

msContents.p: Lemma-organization: The content of the book is ordered into 65 juan. The ordering of the juan is a mix of traditional and modern elements, whereby the thematically related lemmata are to be found therein. The lemmata of each juan do not follow a stroke count arrangement.
Table of contents: Located at the beginning of the book, it is a listing of each juan with each lemma. Not very helpful to get an orientation at the first sight.

Contents: The book offers the information which had been important for the exams. Many written works are mentioned and explained, but also issues like traditional military ranks. The listed books often come with the number of its juan.

history.p: A scan of the work is available at the library of the Institute of Chinese Studies, Heidelberg University.

settingDesc.p: According to the preface Liu was not satisfied with the book cexue dacheng 策學大成 by Cai Mei'an, he therefore wanted to correct its mistakes and wrote a new work. In this undertaking he was supported by many erudite scholars.

textDesc.constitution: The text is ordered into many lemmata, which are mostly comparatively short.
textDesc.purpose: The book should be a preparatory tool for students taking the exams.
